TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IDataObject

Docs.summary: Creates a connection between a caller and a data object implementing the IDataObject interface. This connection enables notifications of changes in the data for the data object to the caller.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about programming with the IDataObject interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

MemberSignature.Value: public int DAdvise (IntPtr a, int b, IntPtr c, ref int d);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 DAdvise(native int a, int32 b, native int c, int32& d) cil managed
Public Function DAdvise (a As IntPtr, b As Integer, c As IntPtr, ByRef d As Integer) As Integer
public: int DAdvise(IntPtr a, int b, IntPtr c, int % d);
abstract member DAdvise : nativeint * int * nativeint * -> int

Docs.param: A pointer to the defining the format, medium, and target device for notifications.
An value specifying the requested behavior for the connection.
A pointer to the on the caller object.
A pointer to the connection set up by this call to the DAdvise method.
Docs.summary: Creates a notification connection between a data object implementing the interface and a caller object, letting the caller receive notification of changes in the data for the data object.
Docs.returns:
The DAdvise method supports the standard returns values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following return values:
| Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | The DAdvise method successfully created the connection. | | E\_NOTIMPL | The data object does not implement the DAdvise method. | | DV\_E\_LINDEX | lindex is not valid. | | DV\_E\_FORMATETC | The data pointer value is not valid. | | OLE\_E\_ADVISENOTSUPPORTED | The object does not support change notification. |

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

MemberSignature.Value: public int DUnadvise (int a);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 DUnadvise(int32 a) cil managed
Public Function DUnadvise (a As Integer) As Integer
public: int DUnadvise(int a);
abstract member DUnadvise : int -> int

Docs.summary: Destroys a notification connection that was created by an earlier call to the method.
Docs.returns: | Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | The DUnadvise method successfully deleted the specified connection. | | OLE\_E\_NOCONNECTION | The specified connection is not a valid connection. | | OLE\_E\_ADVISENOTSUPPORTED | The object does not support change notification. |

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

Public Function EnumDAdvise (a As IntPtr) As Integer
public: int EnumDAdvise(IntPtr a);
abstract member EnumDAdvise : nativeint -> int

Docs.param: The address of the receiving the interface pointer to the new enumerator object. There are no connections if this call to the EnumDAdvise method sets to .
Docs.summary: Retrieves a pointer to an object that can enumerate the notification connections that are currently maintained by this interface.
Docs.returns:
The EnumDAdvise method supports the standard return value E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following return values:
| Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | This call to the EnumDAdvise method successfully created the instance of the enumerator object.-or-There are no connections. | | OLE\_E\_ADVISENOTSUPPORTED | The object does not support change notification. |

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

public: int EnumFormatEtc(int a, IntPtr b);
abstract member EnumFormatEtc : int * nativeint -> int

Docs.param: A value from the indicating the direction of the data.
An output variable address receiving the .
Docs.summary: Retrieves a pointer to an object that can enumerate the enumerator types that this implementation supports.
Docs.returns:
The EnumFormatEtc method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following return values:
| Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | This call to the EnumFormatEtc method successfully created the enumerator object. | | E\_NOTIMPL | The specified direction is not supported. | | OLE\_S\_USEREG | A request to OLE to enumerate the formats from the registry. |

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetCanonicalFormatEtc (IntPtr a, IntPtr b);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetCanonicalFormatEtc(native int a, native int b) cil managed
Public Function GetCanonicalFormatEtc (a As IntPtr, b As IntPtr) As Integer
public: int GetCanonicalFormatEtc(IntPtr a, IntPtr b);
abstract member GetCanonicalFormatEtc : nativeint * nativeint -> int

Docs.param: A pointer to the defining the format, medium, and target device for calls to retrieve data.
An output pointer to a FORMATETC containing the most general information possible for a specific rendering or , if the GetCanonicalFormatEtc method returns DATA_S_SAMEFORMATETC.
Docs.summary: Retrieves a pointer to a standard structure that is logically equivalent to, but not necessarily equal to, the structure that is referenced by the parameter.
Docs.returns:
The GetCanonicalFormatEtc method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following return values:
| Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | The returned FORMATETC is different from the structure passed in the parameters. | | DATA\_S\_SAMEFORMATETC | The returned FORMATETC is the same as the structure passed in the parameters and is returned in . | | DV\_E\_LINDEX | lindex is not valid. | | DV\_E\_FORMATETC | is not valid. | | OLE\_E\_NOTRUNNING | The object application is not running. |

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetCanonicalFormatEtc method allows the implementer of the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface to return a canonical <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC> structure without duplicating the rendering logic for the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC> structure.
For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetData (ref Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC pFormatEtc, ref Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.STGMEDIUM b);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetData(valuetype Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC& pFormatEtc, valuetype Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.STGMEDIUM& b) cil managed
Public Function GetData (ByRef pFormatEtc As FORMATETC, ByRef b As STGMEDIUM) As Integer
public: int GetData(Microsoft::Aspnet::Snapin::FORMATETC % pFormatEtc, Microsoft::Aspnet::Snapin::STGMEDIUM % b);
abstract member GetData : * -> int

Docs.param: A pointer to the defining the format, medium, and target device for calls to retrieve data.
A pointer to the indicating the storage medium containing the returned data.
Docs.summary: Renders the data that is described in the specified pFormatEtc structure and transfers it to the parameter.
Docs.returns:
The GetData method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following return values:
| Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | This call to the GetData method successfully retrieved and placed data in the provided storage medium. | | DV\_E\_LINDEX | lindex is not valid. | | DV\_E\_FORMATETC | is not valid. | | DV\_E\_TYMED | tymed is not valid. | | DV\_E\_DVASPECT | dwAspect is not valid. | | OLE\_E\_NOTRUNNING | The object application is not running. | | STG\_E\_MEDIUMFULL | An error occurred when allocating the medium. |

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetDataHere(valuetype Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC& pFormatEtc, valuetype Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.STGMEDIUM& b) cil managed
Public Function GetDataHere (ByRef pFormatEtc As FORMATETC, ByRef b As STGMEDIUM) As Integer
public: int GetDataHere(Microsoft::Aspnet::Snapin::FORMATETC % pFormatEtc, Microsoft::Aspnet::Snapin::STGMEDIUM % b);
abstract member GetDataHere : * -> int

Docs.param: A pointer to the defining the format, medium, and target device for calls to retrieve data.
A pointer to the indicating the storage medium containing the returned data.
Docs.summary: Renders the data that is described in the specified pFormatEtc structure and transfers it to the parameter.
Docs.returns:
The GetDataHere method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following return values:
| Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | This call to the GetDataHere method successfully retrieved and placed data in the provided storage medium. | | DV\_E\_LINDEX | lindex is not valid. | | DV\_E\_FORMATETC | pFormatEtc is not valid. | | DV\_E\_TYMED | tymed is not valid. | | DV\_E\_DVASPECT | dwAspect is not valid. | | OLE\_E\_NOTRUNNING | The object application is not running. | | STG\_E\_MEDIUMFULL | An error occurred when allocating the medium. |

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetDataHere method differs from the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject.GetData(Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC@,Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.STGMEDIUM@)> method in that the caller must allocate and release the specified storage medium.
For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

MemberSignature.Value: public int QueryGetData (Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC a);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 QueryGetData(valuetype Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC a) cil managed
Public Function QueryGetData (a As FORMATETC) As Integer
public: int QueryGetData(Microsoft::Aspnet::Snapin::FORMATETC a);
abstract member QueryGetData : Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC -> int

Docs.param: A pointer to the defining the format, medium, and target device for calls to retrieve data.
Docs.summary: Retrieves a value indicating whether the implementer can render the data that is contained in the parameter.
Docs.returns:
The QueryGetData method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following return values:
| Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | A subsequent call to the method probably will be successful. | | DV\_E\_LINDEX | lindex is not valid. | | DV\_E\_FORMATETC | pFormatEtc is not valid. | | DV\_E\_TYMED | tymed is not valid. | | DV\_E\_DVASPECT | dwAspect value. | | OLE\_E\_NOTRUNNING | The object application is not running. |

remarks.format:
## Remarks A client of a data object that implements the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface calls the QueryGetData method to determine the likelihood of success of a subsequent call to the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject.GetData(Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC@,Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.STGMEDIUM@)> method. A result indicating that this instance of the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface can render the data that is contained in the `a` parameter does not guarantee success in a subsequent call to the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject.GetData(Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.FORMATETC@,Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.STGMEDIUM@)> method.
For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).

MemberSignature.Value: public int SetData (IntPtr a, IntPtr b, int c);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 SetData(native int a, native int b, int32 c) cil managed
Public Function SetData (a As IntPtr, b As IntPtr, c As Integer) As Integer
public: int SetData(IntPtr a, IntPtr b, int c);
abstract member SetData : nativeint * nativeint * int -> int

Docs.param: A pointer to the defining the format for the data object implementing the to use when interpreting the data contained in the storage medium.
A pointer to the defining the storage medium for the SetData method to use to pass the data.

true to specify that the called data object implementing the owns the storage medium after the call and must free the medium after it has been used; otherwise, false to specify the caller retains ownership of the storage medium and the data object uses the medium for the duration of the call only.
Docs.summary: Transfers the data that is contained in the structure, referenced by , to this instance of the interface.
Docs.returns:
The SetData method supports the standard return values E_FAIL, E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following return values:
| Return value | Description | | --- | --- | | S\_OK | This call to the SetData method successfully transferred the data. | | E\_NOTIMPL | The SetData method is not implemented for the data object implementing the . | | DV\_E\_LINDEX | lindex is not valid. | | DV\_E\_FORMATETC | pFormatEtc is not valid. | | DV\_E\_TYMED | tymed is not valid. | | DV\_E\_DVASPECT | dwAspect is not valid. | | OLE\_E\_NOTRUNNING | The object application is not running. |

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about programming with the <xref:Microsoft.Aspnet.Snapin.IDataObject> interface and the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), see the [MMC Programmer's Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/windows/desktop/mmc/mmc-programmer-s-guide-overview).
